project00.title: Temperature Converter
project00.description: An application that allows users to convert Fahrenheit to Celsius or Celsius to Fahrenheit.

project01.title: Pinterest
project01.description: A Pinterest-style application allowing users to create boards and pins for whatever they like. This project allowed for the use of - and practice with - Axios, promises, and Firebase.
project01.technologiesUsed: Axios, Bootstrap, CSS3, ESLint, Firebase, HTML5, JavaScript/ES6, jQuery, SCSS, Webpack

project02.title: Le Baguette
project02.description: A team-built website utilizing Firebase, Axios, and google authentication that allows users to create, display, update, and delete (CRUD) data from Firebase that immediately reflects on the loaded page. As a part of this group, I contributed the staff page, the filter function on the staff page, and the layout of the homepage.
project02.technologiesUsed: Axios, Bootstrap, CSS3, ESLint, Firebase, HTML5, JavaScript/ES6, jQuery, Moment.js, SCSS, Webpack

project03.title: Jurassic World
project03.description: The second of our team websites, this project also utilized Firebase, Axios, and google authentication we took over from a different group so we performed code refactoring and code cleanup. Additionally, I contributed to retrieving staff data and assigning them to rides as well as creating the modal allowing for that selection.
project03.technologiesUsed: Axios, Bootstrap, CSS3, ESLint, Firebase, Fontawesome, HTML5, JavaScript/ES6, jQuery, Moment.js, Node-cron, SCSS, Webpack

project04.title: Capstone: writersResort
project04.description: writersResort allows users to post poems and invite feedback on those poems. Each user has access to edit and delete their own posts or comments, via Axios calls. Each deleted post also deletes any comments associated with the post. Authentication occurs through Google and pulls user's displayURL and Google Username. Each post/comment is stamped with the time it was created and updated.
project04.technologiesUsed: Axios, Bootstrap, CSS3, ESLint, Firebase, Fontawesome-svg-core, HTML5, JavaScript/ES6, Moment.js, Prop-Types, ReactDOM, ReactJS, React Flip Move, React-fontawesome, React Router DOM, Reactstrap, SCSS

project05.title: Local Storage React Todo App
project05.description: A React todo application that utilizes local storage so refreshing the page does not remove the items in your todo list. Each item in your list can be deleted, or marked as done with strikethrough.
project05.technologiesUsed: CSS3, HTML5, JavaScript/ES6, Material-UI Core, Material-UI Icons, ReactDOM, ReactJS, React Hooks, uuid

project06.title: React Movie Database
project06.description: This application pulls from the OMDB API and allows users to search for movies by title. If an incoherent or incorrect text string is placed in the search box, an alert appears asking for a new string. Results are limited to the top 10 results from the database.
project06.technologiesUsed: Axios, CSS3, ESLint, HTML5, JavaScript/ES6, ReactDOM, ReactJS, React Hooks

project07.title: CoVID-19 Tracker
project07.description: This application tracks the number of confirmed cases, the number of recovered cases, and the number of deaths for CoVID-19 data from a global and country (181 countries) perspective. All data pulled from this API and last date/time of information gathered displayed in cards at top of the page.
project07.technologiesUsed: Axios, Chart.js, Classnames, CSS3, ESLint, HTML5, JavaScript/ES6, Material-UI Core, Moment.js, ReactDOM, ReactJS, React-ChartJS-2, React CountUp, React Hooks

project08.title: React Weather App
project08.description: This application utilizes the openweathermap API and allows users to search for current weather based on city name. For good measure, since the API doesn't specify the state the city is in, latitude and longitude are also listed to provide more specificity. The background changes based on the temperature: at or below 60°F renders a cooler colored background; at or above 61°F renders a warmer colored background.
project08.technologiesUsed: CSS3, HTML5, JavaScript/ES6, ReactDOM, ReactJS, React Hooks

project09.title: React Face Detect
project09.description: This application utilizes the Clarifai API to detect a face within a photo and then frame that face in a white box. Version 1 is limited to 1 face detected per photo.
project09.technologiesUsed: Clarifai, CSS3, ESLint, HTML5, JavaScript/ES6, ReactDOM, ReactJS, Tachyons

project10.title: Breaking Bad Cast
project10.description: This application pulls from the Breaking Bad API and displays 63 character images from the TV show "Breaking Bad". Hovering over any of the the images reveals a character's actor's name, nickname, date of birth, and status (alive or dead). Additionally, the search box at the top of the screen allows users to filter the results by character name.
project10.technologiesUsed: Axios, CSS3, ESLint, HTML5, JavaScript/ES6, ReactDOM, ReactJS, React Hooks

project11.title: Pokémon
project11.description: This application utilizes this GraphQL interface to retrieve data on all 151 original Pokémon. Each Pokémon's name, image, max HP and CP, type, and attacks are listed on their respective cards.
project11.technologiesUsed: @apollo/react-hooks, Apollo Boost, CSS3, ESLint, GraphQL, GraphQL-Tag, HTML5, JavaScript/ES6, ReactDOM, ReactJS

project12.title: YouTube Clone
project12.description: This application pulls data from the YouTube API and, based on the code written, returns the top 5 results from the query. The code also allows an initial query to be returned in the ComponentDidMount and that result is set to 'nashville software school.'
project12.technologiesUsed: Axios, CSS3, ESLint, HTML5, JavaScript/ES6, Material-UI Core, ReactDOM, ReactJS

project13.title: Speech Recognition
project13.description: This application utilizes a user's microphone to listen to speech and converts that speech to text. This application was written in HTML5, CSS3/SCSS, and JavaScript. The Talk button is active and the End button is inactive when the application is not listening. When the application is listening, a user can either stop talking or press the End button to cease recording. The Talk button will become active again once the application is not listening.
